1.title: How studying privilege systems can strengthen compassion
1.subtitle: Her TED Talk offers a shift in the traditional view of race, equity and privilege. McIntosh uses her own experience as a white woman to inform her own knowledge of racial experiences from a white perspective.

1.title: End Police Militarization and Over-Policing
1.subtitle: The tragic and unnecessary killings of George Floyd, Breonna Taylor, Tony McDade – and countless Black people at the hands of law enforcement – confirms what we've known for too long: Lawmakers must take serious action to fix the racist policing systems in our country.

2.title: Justice for Lakeith Smith
2.subtitle: Lakeith Smith, now 20, was charged with the murder of his friend, A’Donte Washington when he was only 15— a crime he did not commit. A'donte died at the hands of a policeman, after the police fired 4 rounds into him - and he currently walks free.

2.title: Did you really just say that?
2.subtitle: Here's advice on how to confront microaggressions, whether you're a target, bystander or perpetrator

3.title: Find Your Representatives
3.subtitle: Here you can find your representatives, how to contact them, bills they’ve introduced, committees they serve on, and political contributions they’ve received.

3.title: StepStitches
3.subtitle: Welcome to StepStitches where you can find unique keepsakes sure to delight. Each item is handmade with love and exquisite care. Both ready to ship and custom made items are available.

products.name: Black Rag Doll - Raggedy Ann Doll
products.description: Cinnamon Annie® is a delightful vintage style doll with a modern twist. This Raggedy Ann style doll is dressed in a pretty floral navy and yellow dress with matching hair bow. Doll dress and hair bow are removable.

products.name: Raggedy Andy Doll - Boy Doll
products.description: Cinnamon Andrew is a fun vintage style doll with a modern twist. This Raggedy Andy style doll is dressed in light blue overalls with a white shirt and dark blue bow tie. Doll clothes are removable.

products.name: Personalized Raggedy Ann Doll
products.description: If you would like a name embroidered on the doll's dress, please choose that option AND write the name or phrase in the Note to Seller box during check-out.  She is Made to Order and will take approximately two weeks to complete before shipping.

4.title: Shop Thoughtful
4.subtitle: thoughtful is a nonprofit that seeks to promote black businesses and create a one-stop-shop for consumers who want to vote with their wallets. thoughtful does not take any commissions off of the businesses it promotes, it is purely a hub designed to uplift and support established Black-owned businesses online.

products.name: Olivia Twist Headband
products.description: This is timeless versatility. Two loops of our cotton fabric linked at center. An alluring piece for easy, low maintenance styles.

products.name: Black Trans Lives
products.description: #BlackTransLivesMatter

products.name: Nano-Ionic Facial Steamer
products.description: Facial steam combined with ionic water particles is up to 10x more effective than other facial steamers in penetrating the skin.

4.title: Omalicha Naturals
4.subtitle: Omalicha translates to beautiful in our native language of Igbo. We handcraft all natural, clean beauty products for the hair and skin designed to bring ones natural beauty to the forefront.

products.name: Sweet Marula Replenishing Facial Serum
products.description: Our Sweet Marula Replenishing Facial serum is a blend of light oils and botanical extracts. This meticulous blend soothes and moisturizes the skin after cleansing, easily penetrating the skin revealing an instant glow.

products.name: Lavender Cucumber Bliss facial toner
products.description: Our Lavender Cucumber Bliss facial toner soothes and restores balance to the skin. Its non-alcoholic astringent fights breakouts without drying the skin.

products.name: Avocado Mango Deep Treatment Mask
products.description: Our Avocado Mango Deep Treatment Mask is a thick, creamy deep conditioner fortified with luscious oils, botanical extracts and soft butters. It is used after cleansing the hair to impart moisture and elasticity back into your strands.

5.title: TGEU International Women’s Day - Inclusivity Media Statement
5.subtitle: On the occasion of the International Women’s Day (IWD) on 8 March, TGEU joins the voices of trans people around the world in denouncing oppression, violence, and hate against women and non-binary people in all spheres of life.

5.title: Seeing White Podcast Series
5.subtitle: Just what is going on with white people? Police shootings of unarmed African Americans. Acts of domestic terrorism by white supremacists. The renewed embrace of raw, undisguised white-identity politics. Unending racial inequity in schools, housing, criminal justice, and hiring. Some of this feels new, but in truth it’s an old story.

6.title: Alter Planning Co.
6.subtitle:
Alter Planning Co was founded by scottie., a young artist and entrepreneur who grew tired of looking for the perfect planner every year. She crafted each product to help fuel the creativity and productivity of those who used it. 

As an artist, scottie. has a deep understanding of the need for structure and wants to inspire more people to create routines and form in their life.

6.title: Smell Good Spa
6.subtitle: Established in 1998, we are purveyors of aromatic products for women who are making a conscientious change in their personal care products. Our products are the cherry-on-top for women who love to live good, feel good and smell good, wholesomely.

7.title: Raycon
7.subtitle: Raycon is built around the mission that everyone deserves to enjoy great audio. We believe amazing audio experiences inspire go-getters around the world and power their everyday lives.

products.name: The Everyday Earbuds
products.description: Our most compact wireless earbuds for your everyday grind. Designed to deliver more powerful sound than any earbuds of its size.

products.name: The Everyday Headphones
products.description: With booming sound and superior noise cancellation, you can block out all distractions and stay focused on your mission.

products.name: The Fitness Belt
products.description: A nifty and lightweight belt to fuel your workouts. Hold your smartphone, Raycon earbuds, and other daily essentials for your run or gym sessions.

7.title: Colorism in the Beauty Industry
7.subtitle: America has progressed tremendously over recent years in terms of racial inequality, but colorism remains to be seen on a global scale.

8.title: What I am learning from my white grandchildren
8.subtitle: Are we in a post-racial society? Do we want to be? Anthony Peterson, an African American, draws from current research and from conversations with his Anglo American grandchildren to address truths about race in 21st century America.

8.title: Center for Policing Equity
8.subtitle: Your donation fuels our ability to lead on the police reform that's necessary. Together we will create a public safety system that protects and preserves justice for all.

9.title: Post 21
9.subtitle: Post 21 was created by a Mother-Daughter duo who wanted a comprehensive marketplace that focused on products from Black-owned businesses. They felt strongly that there’s no reason why these products are consistently being discovered when they should be household names. So, they said let’s create the place we want to shop.

products.name: Ball is Life Dog Tag
products.description: Super cool, fun, and durable Pet ID Tags. There's a tag for you and your pet's personality! Comes with custom engraving, to make sure that your little one is never lost and can always find it's way home.

products.name: B is for Black Boy
products.description: B is for Black Boy was written to celebrate the awe-inspiring nature of the Black male. It speaks life into our Black boys and empowers them to manifest their highest potential. It's intended to author and assert positive representation of Black boys to all audiences.

products.name: Headband
products.description: Handmade upcycled padded headband, with satin ribbon on underside next to hair.

9.title: Reconstruction in America
9.subtitle: Read the Equal Justice Initiative's report on racial violence after the Civil War, from 1865-1876.

10.title: White Privilege: Unpacking the Invisible Knapsack
10.subtitle: As a white person, I realized I had been taught about racism as something that puts others at a disadvantage, but had been taught not to see one of its corollary aspects, white privilege, which puts me at an advantage.

10.title: First police report in Tyre Nichols case does not match video
10.subtitle: An initial police report filed in the hours after the Tyre Nichols traffic stop suggested he was violent and made claims that were contradicted by video later released by police.

11.title: How to overcome our biases? Walk boldly toward them
11.subtitle: Our biases can be dangerous, even deadly — as we've seen in the cases of Michael Brown in Ferguson, Missouri, and Eric Garner, in Staten Island, New York. Diversity advocate Vernā Myers looks closely at some of the subconscious attitudes we hold toward out-groups. She makes a plea to all people: Acknowledge your biases.

11.title: The Case for Reparations
11.subtitle: Two hundred fifty years of slavery. Ninety years of Jim Crow. Sixty years of separate but equal. Thirty-five years of racist housing policy. Until we reckon with our compounding moral debts, America will never be whole.

12.title: Ashay by the Bay
12.subtitle: We are an Independent Minority Owned Business and Deborah Day is the Founder and CEO. She opened the business in 2000 and started selling books online in 2002, establishing Ashay by the Bay as a Book Reseller that Specializes in African American and Multi-Cultural Children’s Books, Baby-3 and K-12 for Schools and Organizations.  We sell a Diverse Selection of books to both the Consumer and Business Markets and we Build Custom Collections for School and Classroom Libraries.  We also sell Gift Cards provide and we are the publishers of the Mindful Messages Curriculum.  Our home office is located in Vallejo, California. and we sell books throughout the US, Canada and select Markets around the world.

12.title: The Other Wes Moore
12.subtitle: Two kids named Wes Moore were born blocks apart within a year of each other. Both grew up fatherless in similar Baltimore neighborhoods and had difficult childhoods; both hung out on street corners with their crews; both ran into trouble with the police. How, then, did one grow up to be a Rhodes Scholar, decorated veteran, White House Fellow, and business leader, while the other ended up a convicted murderer serving a life sentence?

13.title: 26 King Wavy Merch, LLC
13.subtitle: All of our quality brushes are great brushes! They aren't just great for 360 waves. They, too, promote healthy hair in men, women and children, as well as healthy beards.

products.name: Premium Long Handle Brush
products.description: Medium-Hard Brush. This brush is made with nylon bristles and is great for waves, wolfing and natural hair.

products.name: Baby Blue Compression Cap
products.description: Our 2-6 King Wavy Wave Cap is designed to give the ultimate compression. Combined with any of our durags to achieve your maximum 360, 540, 720 wave potential.

products.name: Navy Blue Silk Durag
products.description: Designer Silk Durag

13.title: Abbey Creek Winery
13.subtitle: Abbey Creek is the first black owned winery and vineyard in Oregons recorded history. We play hip hop in the tasting room and have a unconventional approach to the wine experience. Come see what "The Crick Life" is all about at abbeycreekvineyard.com

products.name: 2018 Sparkling Blanc de Noir #JanelleMonáe
products.description: Sparkling. Full of life. This wine is here to celebrate uniqueness and individuality without sacraficing community. No one can be just like you, you can't be like anyone else but that doesn't mean we are alone. Raise a glass and give a toast to the greatness that is you.

products.name: 2019 Pinot Noir Rose #Ohufancyhuh
products.description: What makes you feel like a goddess? What makes you feel like the man? Get yourself a bottle of this uniquely shaped magnum, post a pic on Instagram with the hashtag #OhUFancyHuh, tag us (@abbeycreekwine), and show us your fancy!!

products.name: Sparkling Pinot Gris #Shining
products.description: If I scream out "I'm sorry Ms. Jackson" and you don't say "Ooooo, I am for real", we ain't friends. I don't need that type of negative energy.

14.title: AllGoudes & Services
14.subtitle: Whether you have a college degree and are seeking to make your first steps onto your career path, or just looking to secure steady income by obtaining an entry level position; AllGoudes and Services makes sure that you’ll be ALLGOUDE in your job search! It’s your time! Let us help you display your worth to potential employers.

14.title: Beauty Bakerie
14.subtitle: A single mother and breast cancer survivor, Cashmere Nicole founded Beauty Bakerie in 2011 as a new lipstick brand that was vegan, non-toxic and cruelty-free.

products.name: Chocolate Therapy Sugar Sticks
products.description: A castor oil infused lip liner collection that delivers high-quality custom coverage while lining & defining your lip look. Just add 1/2 cup of sugar and everything will be pretty sweet!

products.name: Eyelash Icing Waterproof Mascara
products.description: Enter the Beauty Bakerie freezer and start ice-ing with our NEW waterproof and volumizing Eyelash Icing Mascara. The perfect topper for your baked beat, Eyelash Icing Mascara will freeze your lashes in place for all-day, all-night long-lasting wear.

products.name: Blending Egg Beauty Sponges
products.description: Cooked up with you in mind, Blending Egg Beauty Sponges were uniquely created to fit in the palm of your hand for seamless blending. Try a recipe with a dash or two of Cake Face Concealer and bake until your heart's content with Flour Setting Powder. Blending Eggs will be your new favorite tool for eggs-traordinary cakin' that's hard to beat! Hehe.

15.title: Brown Toy Box
15.subtitle: Our mission is to normalize Black excellence and create prosperous career pathways for Black children through STEAM education, cultural representation and educational play.

15.title: Shy Chy Books
15.subtitle: Shy Chy Books will offer a series of books all about encouraging children to be themselves and embracing their individuality. The first book, I can't, I can't... I CAN! is about a girl who desires to make friends and participate in different activities, but she is held back by her shyness.

16.title: African-American Heroism in the Military
16.subtitle: Dating all the way back to the American Revolution, African-Americans have played key roles in the history (and success) of the U.S. military. Profiled below are some notable African-Americans and their achievements, as well as milestones in the integration of African-Americans in the U.S. military.

16.title: Children's Books Starring Kids of Color
16.subtitle: Jambo Books is a children's book subscription company.  We send our members 2 or 3 books each month that feature a child of color as the star of a fiction story.
16.moreInfo:
Jambo Books serves children from birth to age 13. Our oldest members, ages 10-13, receive a middle grade novel and a nonfiction companion book that expands on a topic discussed in the novel. We focus on stories about children of color to delight your young readers and reaffirm your values of creating an inclusive and welcoming community.

Jambo means “Hello” in Swahili. Hello is an invitation to start a connection, to learn something new, to expand our notion of what it is to be human. Similarly, we invite our readers to build their own empathy muscles by reading about people who aren't exactly like themselves. Together, we affirm the humanity of every person.

17.title: Fight for Breonna
17.subtitle: Breonna survived the frontlines of a pandemic that disproportionately kills Black people, only to have her life stolen by police. Take Action.

17.title: The Legacy of Malcom X
17.subtitle: This podcast series about Malcom X El-Hajj Malik El-Shabazz brings together scholars from a variety of fields and is an invitation to connect our ideas, research projects, and activism across disciplinary divides.

18.title: Jarvis Boards
18.subtitle: Jarvis Boards' mission has always been to craft paddle boards in Austin, Texas that are environmentally friendly, look great, and perform well. To accomplish this, we employ a wide range of techniques to craft our small-batch production wooden SUPs in our Austin studio.

products.name: Hollow Core Paddle Board Frame Kits
products.description: There is something magical about creating something with your own two hands. Building your own hollow core paddle board will be one of the most rewarding projects that you'll tackle.

products.name: Let's Surf Y'all! Dad hat
products.description: Let's Surf Y'all! Dad hats aren't just for dads. This one's got a low profile with an adjustable strap and curved visor. Available in khaki and light blue.

products.name: Surf Wax Candle
products.description: We teamed up with our friends at Jimbo's Surf Wax to create a unique line of surf wax candles. Each candle is slow cooked over a wood stove in Maine using surf wax and a hint of coconut.

18.title: Alaffia
18.subtitle:
Alaffia is an online Fair Trading company that specializes in soaps and beauty products. We aim to alleviate poverty and advance gender equality through the Fair Trade of indegenious resources and community empowerment projects.

Together, we’re cultivating beauty, equality and empowerment in West Africa and around the globe. Our women’s cooperatives in West Africa handcraft indigenous raw ingredients then the Alaffia team in Olympia, Washington creates the finished products. Alaffia returns the proceeds from the sale of these products to our communities to fund community empowerment and gender equality projects.

19.title: Racism has a cost for everyone
19.subtitle: Racism makes our economy worse — and not just in ways that harm people of color, says public policy expert Heather C. McGhee. From her research and travels across the US, McGhee shares startling insights into how racism fuels bad policymaking and drains our economic potential — and offers a crucial rethink on what we can do to create a more prosperous nation for all.

19.title: Good Thoughts Tea Co
19.subtitle: We are an all natural loose leaf tea company that is centered around the healing properties of herbs. Our main goal is to help heal from the inside out all while reawakening the conversation and experience of tea. Started in 2014 by Ebone’ McCloud, we are located in and operate from Chicago.

products.name: Cinammon Chai
products.description: Cinnamon Chai is our take on the classic chai blend. Benefits: aids digestion, promotes a peace of mind, antioxidant support.

products.name: Half Rising
products.description: Half Rising is a beautifully aromatic cup of oolong tea mixed with kaffir lime leaves and other sweet surprises. Benefits: aids in relieving stress, improves mental health, promotes healthy skin.

products.name: Tea Spoon Set
products.description: These delightful beauties are great for the perfect scoops of our loose leaf tea blends. With each set comes two sizes.

20.title: Frederick Douglass
20.subtitle: Frederick Douglass was an escaped slave who became a prominent activist, author and public speaker.

20.title: Support the Milwaukee Freedom Fund
20.subtitle: The Milwaukee Freedom Fund is extending support to protestors in Kenosha, WI. Their mission is to build on ongoing bail abolition efforts, support immigration efforts, work towards Black and Brown Liberation, and support Black and Brown young people as they build a new world.

21.title: Land Acknowledgement App
21.subtitle: Text the name of a city and state to 855-917-5263 to find out the Indigenous people of that place.

21.title: When the first all-black professional basketball team dominated...back in the ’20s
21.subtitle: "They were literally pioneers and recognized that they were making a statement in front of the audiences."

22.title: Justice for Tete Gulley
22.subtitle: Tete Gulley was a 31 year old queer Black transient. She was also known by some of her family as Otis. She was found hanging from a tree on the evening of May 27th 2019 in Rocky Butte Park. The cause of death was determined to be suicide at the scene but there is evidence of foul play.

22.title: Juneteenth is a federal holiday. What comes next?
22.subtitle: As President Biden signed the Juneteenth National Independence Day Act into law, he acknowledged a current struggle for voting rights.

23.title: United Negro College Fund
23.subtitle: UNCF envisions a nation where all Americans have equal access to a college education that prepares them for rich intellectual lives, competitive and fulfilling careers, engaged citizenship and service to our nation.

23.title: The Sentencing Project
23.subtitle: The Sentencing Project promotes effective and humane responses to crime that minimize imprisonment and criminalization of youth and adults by promoting racial, ethnic, economic, and gender justice.

24.title: Learn about Julius Jones
24.subtitle: Listen to the Jason Flom & Kim Kardashian West talk about Julius Jones’ story.

24.title: Jackie Robinson's Effect on the Negro Leagues & MLB | 'Field of Dreams...Deferred'
24.subtitle: Things actually got tougher for Black baseball players after Jackie Robinson broke the color barrier, as MLB teams followed racist quotas and the Negro Leagues died out. "Many talented Black players got phased out."

25.title: Aloha Glamour
25.subtitle:
Aloha Glamour is a lifestyle movement that promotes women loving themselves wholeheartedly. We are a community of women that empower others to use find and use their voice to turn their tragedies into triumphs and their mess into a message which enables them to build from the inside out...seeing and LIVING in color again. 

Thanks to our inspiring collections and our impeccable customer service, we have been highly successful since day one. Browse through our site and check out the latest additions to our collection, and feel free to get in touch with our team if you need any assistance.

We want you to create a story in each and every Aloha Glamour piece that you wear. What's the color of your story?

25.title: What If I Don't Move to the Back of the Bus?
25.subtitle: Rosa Parks brought together a unique blend of life experiences, a commitment to racial justice, and a flawless reputation to transform a single act of defiance into a defining moment for the modern American civil rights movement.

26.title: When the Negro Leagues Played Through the Great Depression and WWII
26.subtitle: The Negro Leagues struggled financially amid systemic racism and segregation—even before the Great Depression disproportionately devastated Black America. But the game's finest days—with transcendent stars like Satchel Paige and Josh Gibson—still lay ahead.

26.title: Daunte's Funeral and future care of Daunte Jr.
26.subtitle: Please donate to give Daunte Wright the proper burial he deserves and to help his son and son's mother Chyna. And if you can't support financially, please send lots of prayers for the family to get through this tragic loss.

27.title: American Civil Liberties Union
27.subtitle: Donate to the ACLU. The ACLU has been at the center of nearly every major civil liberties battle in the U.S. for over 100 years. This vital work depends on the support of ACLU members in all 50 states and beyond.

27.title: Demand Justice for Casey Christian Goodson Jr
27.subtitle: On Friday, December 4th, 23 year-old Casey Christian Goodson Jr, was shot three times in the back and murdered by police. They mistook his subway sandwich for a gun. Sign this petition to demand justice.

28.title: Yelani
28.subtitle: Yelani products are specifically designed and created for women with naturally curly hair. The product line features chemical free hair care products made from 100% natural ingredients.

products.name: Moisture Blast Conditioning Shampoo
products.description: Infused with natural and top quality ingredients known for their moisturizing properties, our Moisture Blast Conditioning Shampoo gently hydrates, strengthens, deeply moisturizes and revitalizes dull and dry hair.

products.name: Herbal Beard Oil
products.description: Infused with a refreshing blend of all natural ingredients – grape seed, natural oils, essential fatty acids, jojoba and vitamin E – Yelani Men Beard Oil is essential for your beard needs.

products.name: Hand Sanitizer - Rosemary
products.description: Our 8 oz,  liquid hand sanitizer is easily applied with a fine mist spray. It contains 70% alcohol and ships from within the USA.

28.title: Red Bay Coffee
28.subtitle: Red Bay Coffee is at the forefront of what we believe is the fourth wave of coffee—a firm commitment to ensure coffee production is not only high quality and sustainable, but a vehicle for diversity, inclusion, social and economic restoration, entrepreneurship, and environmental sustainability. We are foodies, artists, activists, community folk, and innovators who love, love, love what we do.

products.name: East Fourteenth
products.description: Tanzanian Dark Roast - Blackberry, Dark Chocolate, Date  East Fourteenth is an homage to a past heritage and a link to history in the making. It is the story of Oakland’s wide-reaching cultures and creeds.

products.name: Coffee Mug - Africa's Gift (Black)
products.description: "Coffee Africa's Gift to the World" Coffee Mug - beautiful, stylish, black-on-black design with Red Bay Coffee logo - 12 ounces

products.name: Unisex Sweatshirt - Black Coffee - Black
products.description: Crewneck Sweatshirt - black with black foil print; back Red Bay Coffee logo; 80/20 Poly-Cotton Blend. Locally sourced and screen printed in Oakland, CA.

29.title: Let Sha'Carri Run!
29.subtitle: Sign the petition to reinstate Sha'Carri Richardson and allow this world-class athlete to compete in the 100-meter dash! And revisit the outdated rules around marijuana and athletes.

29.title: Justice For Tony McDade
29.subtitle: Tony McDade was a transgender black man who got killed by police in Tallahassee. Sign this petition and encourage others to do so as well to get his name out there.

30.title: McBride Sisters Winery
30.subtitle: Since 2005, The McBride Sisters’ mission has become clear—to transform the industry, lead by example, and cultivate community, one delcious glass of wine, at a time.

products.name: McBride Sisters Collection Black Girl Magic 2018 California Merlot
products.description: This juicy and sensational wine is a classic Merlot, sophisticated for the wine connoisseur and delicious for the wine novices.

products.name: McBride Sisters Collection Black Girl Magic NV New Zealand Sparkling Brut
products.description: Your new favorite sparkling wine. Pop the bubbly for any celebration or for the days you want to feel extra fancy. You deserve it.

products.name: SHE CAN 4-Pack Sampler
products.description: Yes SHE CAN have it all! Enjoy our most popular sampler including one of each flavor. Four cans is the equivalent of two bottles of wine and an amazing value for these delicious wines and spritzers.

30.title: Revisionist History: Miss Buchanan’s Period of Adjustment
30.subtitle: Revisionist History is a podcast from Malcolm Gladwell and Pushkin Industries.In this episode: A landmark Supreme Court case. A civil rights revolution. Why has everyone forgotten what happened next?

31.title: MoreFire! Hot Sauce
31.subtitle: MoreFire! Hot Sauce is a concoction of spicy fiery goodness. For those who are serious about good quality food. We are 1st place nationwide award winning... so get on the winning Team. You need MoreFire! in your life!

products.name: MoreFire! Hot Sauce (Original)
products.description: 5 oz bottle of the multi-award winning Goldson’s MoreFire! Hot Sauce… Ay Yo! I GOT THAT FIRE!
